Looking at the document, I can see "AINECOL S A S" in cell 11. 2. **TaxId**: For RUB from DIAN, this is in cell "18. Número de identificación". I can see "8001206773-2" or similar. Let me look more carefully... I see "8001206772-3" in cell 18. 3. **IdentificationType**: For RUB from DIAN, this is "NIT". 4. **Country**: Since this is RUB from DIAN, the country is "Colombia". I'll now focus on extracting detailed information for the first beneficiary, starting with the name components from specific cells. The first beneficiary is RAMIRO ANDRES ESCOBAR PUENTES, with identification number 1075214370. His participation is 15%, and the record indicates an update status. The NIT matches his identification number, suggesting consistent documentation. The second beneficiary shares the family name ESCOBAR PUENTES - MARIA XIMENA - with identification 26421587. Her participation is also 15%, and her record similarly shows an update status. For the third beneficiary, I notice some incomplete information, with only first and last names partially recorded. The fourth beneficiary is RAMIRO ESCOBAR PUENTES, identified by 12124202. His participation increases to 52%, maintaining an update status. The fifth beneficiary appears to be OLGA PATRICIA PUENTES SANDINO, with an identification number beginning with 36173009, though the record seems partially truncated. All beneficiaries are classified under the NIT identification type according to DIAN's regulatory framework.
